content.title: Pararenal Abdominal Aortic Aneurysm
content.description: An abdominal aortic aneurysm that involves the aorta at the level of the renal arteries, requiring renal artery reconstruction during repair.
content.definition: Pararenal AAA involves aneurysmal dilation at the level of one or both renal artery origins, necessitating renal artery reimplantation, bypass, or fenestrated/branched endovascular repair. Distinguished from juxtarenal AAA by actual involvement of renal ostia.

key_anatomic_criteria: Aneurysm incorporates one or both renal artery origins
Often associated with complex aortic anatomy
treatment_approaches: Open repair with suprarenal clamp and renal reimplantation
Fenestrated EVAR with renal artery fenestrations
Branched EVAR for antegrade renal stent placement
surgical_considerations: Cold renal perfusion during clamp time

learning_objectives: Distinguish pararenal from juxtarenal and suprarenal AAA
Recognize indications for fenestrated vs branched EVAR
clinical_pearls: Pararenal AAAs comprise 5-10% of all AAAs
Preoperative CT angiography must assess all renal artery origins
Accessory renal arteries <4mm may be sacrificed if main renal preserved
Renal warm ischemia time should be minimized to <30 minutes

content.statement: Pararenal Abdominal Aortic Aneurysm is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Aaa that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding Pararenal Abdominal Aortic Aneurysm helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Pararenal Abdominal Aortic Aneurysm include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Pararenal Abdominal Aortic Aneurysm.
